Judge may stay inmate's sex-change surgery order

The judge who ruled earlier this year that a convicted killer be allowed to undergo a sex-change operation at the state's expense said Monday he is leaning toward ordering a stay of the surgery. (Boston Globe)

Hostess Brands Inc. and its second largest union agreed to try to resolve their differences after a bankruptcy judge noted that the parties hadn't gone through private mediation. (AP)

Hospital room is now
Mayor Menino’s office

For the past 25 days, the mayor has been working from Brigham and Women’s Hospital, where he is being treated for a ­variety of ailments.
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Patriots stay mum on Gronkowski

The tight end had surgery for a broken left forearm . . . we think. It’s not certain because the team refuses to publicly acknowledge that Gronk is hurt.

Highway system, T face big deficits

The MBTA faces a $130 million deficit for the next budget year, but that daunting gap is eclipsed by a $240 million highway system shortfall.
Opinion | Kevin Cullen

The truth never dies

Louie Greco died in prison, an innocent man, because the FBI had no qualms about letting four innocent men take the rap for an informant’s crime.

TV spoilers becoming unavoidable

The obsession with sharing everything we know on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sites means that what happens on TV doesn’t stay on TV.
Opinion | Farah Stockman

Baby, please don’t go

Talk of secession could be a sign of irreconcilable differences in our relationship to the federal government.

Chicken saves charities’ holiday

Higher prices and growing demand have forced more charity groups to hand out chickens instead of turkeys to struggling families.
